TopicTitle: KSP Moving user data to another PC

Articles.Content: I found a couple old threads on the net with some file paths but can't get to show up on a different PC with KSP installed. Can't double click the files to open. And can't see when open Kerbal. Thanks
Are you asking where you can find the game files? "I can't click something" is a really bad description for anything.

11 hours ago, Harry Rhodan said:

Are you asking where you can find the game files? "I can't click something" is a really bad description for anything.

When you double click a file windows tries to open it. Whats hard about that. When I read "game files" it sounded like game files like the EXE. 

User data. Whatever the kid needs to open their game stuff on another PC. We tried copying the SAVES and or SHIPS folders and they wouldn't open from the same path on another PC. (would not show up in Kerbal)

Edited December 13, 2018 by FranksPickles

On 12/13/2018 at 8:47 PM, FranksPickles said:

Whats hard about that.

That you don't tell people what you're double clicking and why your double clicking it. You mention some threads but not where they are or what steps you're trying to follow. This is really frustrating to decipher.

In the worst case just copy the whole Kerbal Space Program folder. The game will run even if you don't install it.

On 12/14/2018 at 5:24 PM, Harry Rhodan said:

That you don't tell people what you're double clicking and why your double clicking it. You mention some threads but not where they are or what steps you're trying to follow. This is really frustrating to decipher.

In the worst case just copy the whole Kerbal Space Program folder. The game will run even if you don't install it.

 

what he said, your install path could be in a couple different places though depending if you got the game from steam or not.
Im lazy, so just copy the entire folder to somewhere with a shot name.
